message.content:
cs.NI, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.MM

This paper deals with the integration of UAVs into LTE-Advanced heterogeneous networks (HetNets) to enhance wireless connectivity and support emerging services. This involves system-level understanding to modify and extend the existing terrestrial network infrastructure. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). 

The paper also uses heuristic algorithms such as genetic algorithm (GA) and elitist harmony search algorithm based on genetic algorithm (eHSGA) to optimize the locations of aerial base-stations (UAVs) in the HetNet. This involves optimization and decision-making, which are key areas of artificial intelligence (AI). Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a likely sub-category. 

The paper also evaluates the performance of the HetNet in terms of fifth percentile spectral efficiency (5pSE) and coverage probability, which are metrics related to system dynamics and control. Therefore, cs.SY (Systems and Control) is another likely sub-category. 

The paper also uses techniques such as cell range expansion (CRE), inter-cell interference coordination (ICIC), and 3D beamforming, which are related to information theory and signal processing. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is another likely sub-category. 

Finally, the paper deals with the integration of UAVs into the HetNet to support emerging services, which may involve multimedia applications.
